title: bond: Rename `missed_max` to `arp_missed_max`
body:
Renaming `missed_max` to `arp_missed_max`, to be consist with kernel
code and document.

Also hide many invalid options due to limitation of kernel code.

title: New release 1.2.8
body:
== Break changes

 * N/A

== New features

 * Add support of filtering via `NetStateFilter`. (f128da4, c130bb6)
 * SR-IOV: Include SRIOV VF information per VF interface. (fd3c489)
 * New bond options: (77ede43)
   * `BondInfo.lacp_active`
   * `BondInfo.missed_max`
   * `BondInfo.ns_ip6_target`

== Bug fixes

 * Expose `MptcpAddressFlag`. (dd2a427)

title: bridge port: Add support of IFLA_BRPORT_LOCKED
bond: Add 3 properties
body:
Add support of these NLA:

 * `IFLA_BOND_AD_LACP_ACTIVE`: `BondInfo.lacp_active: Option<bool>`
 * `IFLA_BOND_MISSED_MAX`: `BondInfo.missed_max: Option<u8>`
 * `IFLA_BOND_NS_IP6_TARGET`: `BondInfo.ns_ip6_target: Option<Vec<Ipv6Addr>>`

Test case updated for first two. The `ns_ip6_target` does not have sysfs
or iproute support, hence not able to test it yet.

title: cli: Do not filter on interface name
body:
When we apply filter on interface name, we lose the information on its
ports(for example, npc bond99 will not have any bond port information).

Hence we remove the interface name filter.

title: dependency: Upgrade to serde_yaml 0.9
body:
Fix the tests by using `assert_value_match` instead of hard yaml equal
check as `serde_yaml` changed its output.

title: bond: Use new rtnetlink parser for bond options
body: The rtnetlink 0.11 has bond option parse which could simplify our code.

title: state: Support interface filtering
body:
Introducing these filters:
 * `NetStateFilter`
 * `NetStateIfaceFilter`
 * `NetStateRouteFilter`
 * `NetStateRouteRuleFilter`

By default, full information will be retrieved. To query only the
interested part, please use `NetStateFilter::minimum()` along with
sub-filter set to `Some()`.

Removed public API `retrieve_routes_with_filter()` as it could be done
via:

```rust
    let mut route_filter = NetStateRouteFilter::default();
    let mut filter = NetStateFilter::minimum();
    filter.route = Some(route_filter);
```

The command line tool -- npc is updated to practise this filtering.

title: license: Replace long license to simple SPDX
body:
In stead of maintaining the year number in the complex license statement
in very file, replacing it with one line SPDX statement could save our
efforts.

title: route: Support kernel side filter for route dump
body:
With `NETLINK_GET_STRICT_CHK` enabled via `setsockopt()`, the kernel
will not include unmatch route in route dumping, this save the
usespace from filtering it afterwards.

User may use `nispor::retrieve_routes_with_filter()` for this kernel
filter.

The CLI tool updated to use this for command like `npc route -p static`.

title: SR-IOV: Include SRIOV VF information per VF interface
body:
Added `pf_name: Option<String>` property to `struct VfInfo`. Included
`VfInfo` to VF interface as `pub sriov_vf: Option<VfInfo>`.

Also updated python binding:

 * `NisporSriovVf.pf_name`  -> String or None
 * `NisporBaseIface.sr_iov_vf` -> NisporSriovVf or None

title: Add document for generating cargo vendor tarbal
New release 1.2.7
body:
## Break changes

 * N/A

## New features

 * Add support of MPTCP path management. (a5e0108)

## Bug fixes

 * Fix SR-IOV VF MAC address parsing. (723c090, e2c19da, 91076ed,
   06ca1f7)
 * Fix veth created by iproute with `netns` argument. (5e8eb7d)

title: New release 1.2.6
body:
== Break changes

 * clib: Change SONAME from libnispor.1.2 to libnispor.so.1

== New features

 * N/A

== Bug fixes

 * drop the need of serde_derive. (4857775)
 * Use latest rust-netlink crates. (45ba94a)

title: veth: fix report of veth peer on a different netns
body:
When the veth peer is on a different netns, the ifindex counting start
from "1" again. That means, if the veth has ifindex 30 one could expect
the peer will have ifindex 31 but if it is on a different netns, the
ifindex could be completetly different, e.g "2".

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: Use latest rust-netlink crates
body: The `netlink-package-route` 0.12 has `AfSpecBridge` parsed, so we move our code.

title: [th/fix-sriov-mac-addrs] fix regression for parsing SR-IOV VFs from netlink
body:
Commit 25f186819f0e changes `mac::parse_as_mac()` to be strict. However, SR-IOV VFs (`IFLA_VF_MAC`, `IFLA_VF_BROADCAST`) are not only 6 bytes long. Hence, the entire VF failed to parse. The effect is, that it appears as if there is no VF.

Fix that by relaxing the check. Also a few followup patches for consideration.

Fixes: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2090678

title: Add support MPTCP
body:
Also include python bonding and CLI support.

Example output of `npc mptcp`:

```yaml
---
enabled: true
add_addr_accepted_limit: 1
subflows_limit: 1
addresses:
  - address: 192.0.2.2
    id: 1
    flags:
      - signal
    iface: eth2
  - address: "2001:db8:f::1"
    id: 2
    flags:
      - backup
    iface: eth2
```

Those address also shown in the interface level, example of
`npc iface eth2`:

```yaml
---
- name: eth2
  iface_type: veth
  #many_lines_omitted
  mptcp:
    - address: 192.0.2.2
      id: 1
      flags:
        - signal
      iface: eth2
    - address: "2001:db8:f::1"
      id: 2
      flags:
        - backup
      iface: eth2
```

title: clib: Change SONAME to libnispor.so.1
body: The correct SONAME should only contain major version number.

title: New release 1.2.5
body:
Bug fixes:
 * apply: Enable Default traits for VethConf and VlanConf. (3b3f446)
 * ipoib: Add base_iface property. (9349ed7)
 * clib: Update Cargo.toml with description and etc. (4494f54)
 * npc: Update Cargo.toml for `cargo publish`. (26d8bb6)
 * npc: Use specific version for `cargo publish`.  (4f0faa3)

title: Revert "bridge: Use patched netlink-packet-route as workaround"
body: This reverts commit 59b8d1124756dabaeccac870e8664619c0349ebe.

title: bridge: Use patched netlink-packet-route as workaround
body:
Due to issue of https://github.com/little-dude/netlink/pull/247 , nispor
could not show contain bridge on kernel supporting
`IFLA_BR_MCAST_QUERIER_STATE`.

Instead of waiting rust-netlink to tag new release, we are including
patched `netlink-package-route` into this project and switch to upstream
once they have new release.

title: apply: Enable Default traits for VethConf and VlanConf
ipoib: Add base_iface property
body:
When certain IPoIB interface is p-key based interface, show the
`base_iface` for its parent.

title: npc: Use specific version for `cargo publish`
body: Local dependency is not allowed for `cargo publish`

title: New release: 1.2.4
body:
## Break changes
 * Mark all public struct/enum as `non_exhaustive`. (58fa534)

## New features
 * Support max and min MTU. (892dcc5, cebe8ea)
 * Support changing dynamic IP. (43e9496)
 * Support changing route. (b8ffe1a, 06cc9c8)
 * Support mulitpath route in python binding. (e70991e)
 * Support IP over InfiniBand. (f374d62)

## Bug fixes
 * Remove all usages of `expect`. (25f1868)

title: InfiniBand: add IP over InfiniBand support
body: This patch is adding support to IPoIB interfaces on Nispor.

title: CI: Move lint/fmt check to standalone test group
npc: Include link information for bond/bridge/vlan/etc
npc: Upgrade to clap 3.1 and tidy up output
body:
* Upgrade to clap 3.1
 * Show IPs and gateways in multiple lines
 * Show link type

title: test route: Add test of default gateway
Remove usage of "expect"
body:
This PR remove all usages of "expect" as requested in issue #106, replacing it for a more proper error handling.

The second commit removes an unnecessary error check in `parse_bridge_id`.

title: iface: get min_mtu and max_mtu attributes as Option
body:
Issue #168 was open and I started to work on it, but it was already solved by commit 892dcc5b5. However, I had forgot to fetch last changes and started working on top of a some weeks old version of nispor, and I didn't see it.

Anyway, in my implementation I had choose to use Option instead of an integer because it gives better semantics to know when the value doesn't make sense and should be used. Since I had it already done, I submit the changes just in case you find it better.

If you don't think it is worth it, I'm fine with you just rejecting this PR.

title: ip: Change IP configuration workflow
body:
Previously, we require user to provide full IP stack information which
require nispor do complex IP stack modification internally.
This is against the nispor design.

Change the IP modification in nispor to:
 1. Add IP using desire state
 2. Use `remove: true` to remove desired IP

Test cases and example files updated.

title: python: Add support of multipath route
body:
Introducing:
 * `NisporRoute.multipath` property
 * `NisporMultipathRoute` class

title: route: Support changing route protocol
body:
Example yaml:

```
routes:
- dst: 203.0.113.0/24
  oif: veth1
  via: 192.0.2.2
  metric: 500
  table: 254
  protocol: dhcp
```

Integration test case updated.

title: route: Support changing routes
body:
Example yaml files included.

Integration test case included.

title: API: Mark all public struct/enum as `non_exhaustive`
body:
All the public struct/enum in nispor might add members/type, hence
marking them as `non_exhaustive` which will prevent API user from
in-compatibility usage.

Please refer to https://github.com/nispor/nispor/pull/173 for more detail

title: ip: Fix failure of repeat dynamic IP set call
body:
On the repeat call of setting dynamic IP, nispor will failure on EEXIST OS
error. To fix that, we remove existing matching dynamic IP before setting
them.

Integration case included.

title: Add support of dynamic IP
body:
Example yaml:

```yml
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    ipv4:
      addresses:
        - address: "192.0.2.1"
          prefix_len: 24
          valid_lft: 120sec
          preferred_lft: 60sec
    ipv6:
      addresses:
        - address: "2001:db8:a::9"
          prefix_len: 64
          valid_lft: 121sec
          preferred_lft: 61sec
```

Integration test case included.

title: New release: 1.2.3
body:
Bug fixes:
 * Fix bridge vlan filtering on i40e. (5bc1603)
 * Expose struct member of ethtool. (60483d9)

title: bridge vlan: Fix querying on i40e
body:
Problem:

    Cannot show the VLAN filtering on i40e card.

Root cause:

    The i40e driver is using two netlink messages for AfSpecBridge.
    The first one contains IFLA_BRIDGE_VLAN_INFO, the second one contains
    IFLA_BRIDGE_MODE and IFLA_BRIDGE_FLAGS.
    The second parse done by nispor is overriding the first one.
    Hence nispor is showing vlan filter as None.

Fix:

    Extend the VLAN filtering information instead of overriding.

title: ethtool: Mark struct member as pub
New release 1.2.2
body:
Bug fix:
 * Fix the crash of npc commnad line.(73d0e1b)

title: New release 1.2.1
body:
## Break changes
 * N/A
 * 
## New features
 * Include SR-IOV VF interface name in `VfInfo`. (1e74459)
 * Implement From BridgePortMulticastRouterType to u8. (b15f82a)
 * Added `--delete` option to npc for deleting a interface. (0b273d5, e8b0a49)
 * Expose VlanConf. (bd64243)

## Bug fixes
 * N/A

title: sriov: Include VF interface name in VfInfo
body:
Currently there is no valid netlink way to get information as the kernel
code is in at PCI level: `drivers/pci/iov.c`.

We use the first nic name in sysfs folder
`/sys/class/net/<pf_name>/devices/virtfn<sriov_id>/net/` as VF interface
name.

Python binding is also updated by including new property:
`NisporSriovVf.iface_name`.

This has been tested on:
 * Intel X520: ixgbe
 * BCM BCM57414: bnxt_en
 * Mellanox MT27710: mlx5_core

title: bridge: Implement From BridgePortMulticastRouterType to u8
npc: New argument to delete a interface
body:
To delete a interface:

    npc iface <iface_name> --delete

title: CHANGELOG: New release 1.2.0
body:
Break changes
 * N/A

New features
 * Support creating linux bridge. (b1f1e0f)
 * Support creating VETH. (af09cab)
 * Support changing MAC address. (f582227)
 * Support creating VLAN. (5b172da)
 * Support changing link state(up/down). (d5de240)
 * Support creating bond. (466c785)
 * support changing controller. (b1815e7)

Bug fixes
 * Use upstream ethtool crate instead vendoring. (4202aa7)
 * Fix CLI interface name filter on querying. (1e0f092)

title: ethtool: Use upstream ethtool implementation
body:
Use the ethtool crate in https://github.com/little-dude/netlink instead
of local maintained fork

title: mac: Restore the interface state after MAC changed
body:
It is required to bring down the interface before changing MAC address,
we should restore the previous UP state after MAC changed.

Test case updated for this use case.

title: mac: Support changing MAC address
body:
Example on changing MAC address of interface:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    type: veth
    mac_address: "00:02:03:04:05:06"
    veth:
      peer: veth1.ep
```

Test case updated to assert desired MAC applied.

title: cli: Fix the interface name filter on querying
Enable logging
body:
The library only use `log` crate to define the logging abstracts.
User should chose their actual logging implementation if they would like
to enable the logging.

The command tool `npc` use `env_logger` as logging implementation. By
default `npc` will only show warning+ message from nmstate.

    * `npc -v` show info+ message from nmstate.
    * `npc -vv` show debug+ message from nmstate.
    * `npc -vvv` show debug+ message from all sources.

title: lib: update libc, netlink and tokio dependencies
body:
The dependencies are being updated in order to do the packaging in
Fedora.

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: vlan: Support creating VLAN
body:
Example of npc yaml:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: vlan0
    type: vlan
    vlan:
      base_iface: eth1
      vlan_id: 99
```

For performance and complexity concern, the base interface should be
created beforehand, nispor will fail if otherwise.

Integration test case included.

title: controller: Support changing controller
body:
Example of npc yaml:

```yml
---
ifaces:
 - name: bond0
   type: bond
 - name: veth1
   type: veth
   controller: bond0
   veth:
     peer: veth1.ep
```

Not mentioned controller means detach from controller.

Integration test case updated to test bond port attach and detach.

title: bond: Add support of creating bond
body:
Example yaml for npc:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: bond0
    type: bond
```

Integration test case included.

title: link: Support link up/down
body:
By default, NetConf assume `IfaceState::Up`. You may bring a interface down
using `IfaceState::Down`. This is example for `npc set`:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    state: down
```

Integration test case included.

title: bridge: support create bridge
body:
Example for `npc set`:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: br0
    iface_type: bridge
```

Integration test case included.

title: test vrf: github action CI does not support VRF
API: Expose all public struct and enum
New release 1.1.1
body:
* Break changes
    * Running `npc` command without argument will only show bridge network
   information. (69cc9aa)

* Bug fixes
    * Fix ethool feature on tx-lockless which is always unchangable. (235458b)
    * Fix detection of loopback interface type. (11eb434)
    * Remove the use of `unwrap()` in ethtool code. (6ea512e)

title: bridge: Add support of new bridge port options
body:
Add support of these options:
 * `IFLA_BRPORT_MRP_RING_OPEN`
 * `IFLA_BRPORT_MRP_IN_OPEN`
 * `IFLA_BRPORT_MCAST_EHT_HOSTS_LIMIT`
 * `IFLA_BRPORT_MCAST_EHT_HOSTS_CNT`

title: clippy: Clean up as suggested by cargo clippy
body:
Also enable CI for `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` which treat clippy
warning as failure.

title: ethtool: Library should never use unwrap()
body: Replaced `unwrap()` with `?`.

title: loopback: Fix interface type of loopback
body:
Using `IFF_LOOPBACK` interface flag to determine whether a interface is
loopback or not is incorrect as other type interface would also hold
this flag.

Fixed to use `ARPHRD_LOOPBACK` from link_layer_type.

title: ethtool feature: tx-lockless is not changeable
body:
Currently, the `tx-lockless` is shown as changeable, but it actually is
hard coded as not changeable by `NETIF_F_NEVER_CHANGE` in kernel.

The kernel netlink use `ETHTOOL_A_FEATURES_NOCHANGE` for hard coded
non-changeable features, it take priority over `ETHTOOL_A_FEATURES_HW`.

Integration test case included, but disable in CI as CI has no ethtool
netlink interface in kernel.

title: npc: Show brief network state when no argument
body:
When running `npc` without any argument, instead of dumping all
information, this patch changed to show brief network status.

Added new sub command `iface` to `npc` for old behaviour:

    * `npc eth1` -- show eth1 interface info.
    * `npc iface eth1` -- the same as `npc eth1`.
    * `npc iface` -- show full information in yaml format.
    * `npc` -- show brief network state.
    * `npc --json` -- show brief network state in json format.

Example on running `npc` without argument:

```
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,LOWERUP,RUNNING,UP> state unknown mtu 65536
    mac 00:00:00:00:00:00
    ipv4 127.0.0.1/8
    ipv6 ::1/128
2: eth1: <BROADCAST,LOWERUP,MULTICAST,RUNNING,UP> state up mtu 1500
    mac 00:01:02:03:04:05
    ipv4 192.0.2.6/24 gw4 192.0.2.1
    ipv6 2001:db8::6/64 fe80::6/64 gw6 fe80::1
```

This patch contains many memory copy done by `to_string()`, `clone()`,
`to_vec()`. We can improve it in future if that cause any problem.

title: New release 1.1.0
body:
New features
 * Support ethtool link mode. (c23e7b5)
 * Support ethtool ring. (ddb9b57)
 * Support ethtool coalesce. (29bd758)
 * Support ethtool features/offload. (9ddd42f)
 * Support ethool pause. (63e2211, 0c0aeda)
 * Support bond vlan+srcmac hashing option. (32e5d0a)
 * Support permanent MAC address. (ef5b56d)
 * Initial tech-preview support on changing IP address. (c6757ec)

Break changes
 * Varlink interface been removed. (6a1d14a)

title: iface: Add permanent_mac_address support
body:
Using IFLA_PERM_ADDRESS to get permanent MAC address.

Python binding updated.

title: ethtool: Add support of ethtool link mode
body:
```yaml
  link_mode:
    auto_negotiate: false
    ours:
      - FIBRE
      - 10000baseT/Full
      - Pause
    speed: 10000
    duplex: full
```

Python binding also updated. Test case updated to use TUN for link mode,
disabled as CI does not support it.

title: ethtool: Add support of ethtool ring
body:
Example on `npc eno3` output on one igb NIC:

```yaml
ethtool:
  ring:
    rx: 256
    rx_max: 4096
    tx: 256
    tx_max: 4096

```

Python binding also updated.

No test case yet as there is no software based NIC for this.

title: ethtool: Add ethtool coalesce support
body:
Example on `npc tun1` output:

```yaml
ethtool:
  coalesce:
    rx_max_frames: 60
```

Python binding also updated.

Test case included but disabled as CI has ethtool netlink disabled.

title: ethtool: Add ethtool features/offload support
body:
Example(paritally) on `npc lo` output:

```yaml
ethtool:
  features:
    fixed:
      esp-hw-offload: false
      esp-tx-csum-hw-offload: false
    changeable:
      rx-gro: true
      rx-gro-list: false
```

Python binding also updated.

Test case updated.

title: Cargo.toml: Use `derive` feature instead of `serde_derive`
body:
As suggested by https://serde.rs/derive.html , we should use

```
    serde = { version = "1.0", features = ["derive"] }
```

title: ethtool: Fix pause info dumping
body:
Due to bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1953847 , the
kernel will not set `NLM_F_MULTI` flags to instruct rust-netlink to
parse multiple netlink message in single socket reply.

To workaround this problem, use `NLM_F_ACK` flag where kernel
acknowledgment on data finish is required, so rust-netlink will keep
parsing till got the ACK netlink message.

And previous `for msg in handle.execute().try_next()` is wrong, should
use `while` against saved handle execution instead.

Test case updated to test against two netdevsim interfaces.

title: src: add missing copyright statement in rust files
MAC VLAP/VTAP: Fix the order of derives
body:
The `serde(rename_all)` should be used after `derive(Serialize,
Deserialize)` as suggested by rust 1.53.0-nightly

title: ethtool: Add ethtool PAUSE support
body:
Example on `npc sim0` output against netdevsim nic:

```yaml
  ethtool:
    pause:
      rx: true
      tx: true
      auto_negotiate: false
```

Python binding also updated.

 Test case included but disabled for CI as CI system has no netdevsim kernel module

title: Makefile: remove varlink leftovers
body: Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: varlink: remove the varlink support
body:
There is no real user for varlink support on nispor. This patch is
removing the varlink support and all the documentation related to it.

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: vlan: Use 'ref mut' instaed of clone
body:
With clone one has to make a new copy and story it back to the member,
we can use ref mut so we use a mutable reference to the field and we
don't have to copy and assign it again.

Closes #34 

Signed-off-by: Quique Llorente <ellorent@redhat.com>

title: tests: fix CI errors on github actions
body: Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: bond: add support to vlan+srcmac tx hashing option
body:
The new vlan+srcmac tx hashing option is now available at kernel
upstream. Nispor should support it.

Ref: https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/netdev/net-next.git/commit/?id=7b8fc0103bb51d1d3e1fb5fd67958612e709f883

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: CI: Use Ubuntu 20.04
body:
Changes:
 * Switch to Ubuntu 20.04 LTS.
 * Use actions-rs/toolchain@v1 to install rust.
 * Use `.cargo/config.toml` to instruct `cargo test` to use sudo.
 * Only run memory check on rust stable matrix.

title: CI: Don't compile twice
body:
Use `sudo cargo build` so that we don't have to build again in
`sudo make check`.

title: NisporError: Eliminate the duplicate memory copy
body:
Changed the `NisporError::bug` and etc functions to take `String` as
argument, so the we don't do duplicate memory copy like:

    (&format("{}", a)).to_string()

Also changed these functions to crate use only.

title: CI: Only run format check on rust stable version
Support create/delete veth interface
body:
Example yaml for `npc set`:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    type: veth
    veth:
      peer: veth1.ep
    ipv4:
      addresses:
        - address: "192.0.2.1"
          prefix_len: 24
    ipv6:
      addresses:
        - address: "2001:db8:a::9"
          prefix_len: 64
```

To delete a interface, you may:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    state: absent
```

The creating of 1000 veth interface(including another 1000 veth peer)
takes 5.120 seconds.

Integration tests for creating and delete veth have been included.

title: .github: add rust nightly and beta to CI
body:
This patch is removing .travis.yml and disabling it. In addition, it is
adding rust nightly and beta to the github action CI runner.

Signed-off-by: Fernando Fernandez Mancera <ffmancera@riseup.net>

title: test: Don't ignore failure of `NetState::retrieve()`
body: We should panic when `NetState::retrieve()` failed in test.

title: ip: Support changing IP address
body:
Supporting applying below state via `npc set a.yml`:

```yml
---
ifaces:
  - name: veth1
    ipv4:
      addresses:
        - address: "192.0.2.1"
          prefix_len: 24
    ipv6:
      addresses:
        - address: "2001:db8:a::9"
          prefix_len: 64
```
